page.title: 15St. Katherine's Convent.
page.content: Founded in 1879, The Community of St. atherine of Alexandria is an Anglican Augustinian order whose aims are for the increase of Religion and care for the needy. Originally sited in London, bombed out by the Flying Bomb blitz in 1944, and after temporary premises in the provinces moved to Parmoor (home of the Cripps Family) in 1947. The Revd. Mother, with four nuns, presides over a household of twenty five people. The sisters, a nurse and gardener, assisted by voluntary workers, care for elderly ladies, each of whom have a room of their own. The work of the Community is funded by investments and donations. Twice a year bazaars are held to augment funds and are well patronised by local people and friends of the household who travel from far afield.
